text: What is the capital city of France?
Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
What is the chemical symbol for water?
In what year did World War II end?
Who wrote the play *Romeo and Juliet*?
What is the square root of 144?
What is the largest organ in the human body?
Which element has the atomic number 6?
Which country has the most time zones?
What is the derivative of sin(x)?
Which African nation has Spanish as an official language?
Who developed the general theory of relativity?
What number comes next in the sequence: 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, ?
What is the only known metal that is liquid at room temperature?
What is the name of the mathematical object that generalizes the notion of curves and surfaces to higher dimensions, central to differential geometry and general relativity?
Which number is the smallest sociable number greater than 1 (i.e., the smallest number in a cycle of aliquot sums longer than 2)?
What is the name of the obscure 9th-century manuscript that contains a mix of Latin and Old High German, often cited as one of the earliest examples of code-switching?
Which 19th-century mathematician proved that there are infinitely many transcendental numbers, but only gave two explicit examples (e and π)?
Which unique chemical element is named after a real continent, not a country, state, or city?
What is the name of the lost ancient Greek city described by Strabo and rediscovered in 2001 near the village of Palaiokastro in Thessaly, Greece?
